p: Similarly, we used chi-squared contingency table analysis to compare if differences in response to climate change in threatened and non-threatened species differ from expected by chance [ 43]. We converted both predictor variables ΔRange and ΔSuitability into categories by considering the frequencies of range contraction or population decline (negative values) versus range expansion or population increase (positive values). Finally, we used student t-tests to compare if responses significantly differ for these two groups.
